intro: Lepidium oblongum, commonly known as wild cress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring small, green, lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruits are small, dry pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Lepidium oblongum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich environments.
